displaytitle: Ridley and Latimer Embracing: study for The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer
creditline: Gift of George L. Small, Class of 1943
inscribed:
in ink, lower left: pity | respect | admiration | fainting | commiseration | scorn | brutality | hardheartedness | old & young women | monks, etc.
in ink, lower right: Dr Smith full canonicals | The preacher Roman [underlined] | Lord William & the Commissioners | The Mayor Aldermen | [illegible] all around | George Shipside his Brother | & his wife. & other woman | monks & populace | qy[illegible] how high the center may be | or the judge persecutor 
in ink, lower center: The Last Embrace of the Martyr | Holy Bishop Martyrs [last four words crossed out] Ridley & Latimer | Martyred Bishops
signed: Dated and signed in brown ink, lower right: May 30. 1854 | G.H.

titles.title: Ridley and Latimer Embracing and Composition Study

Album containing 99 original drawings and 87 architecture, portrait, and costume studies of a documentary nature for the paintings Latimer Preaching at Paul's Cross and The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer.

makers.displaymaker: Sir George Hayter, 1792–1871; born and died London, England
